Problem:

Given a shifted spectrum \\(X(f-f_0)\\), can we unequivocally determine that the original signal was multiplied by \\(e^{2\\pi i f_0 t}\\) without knowing the original form of \\(X(f)\\)?
Explanation: Without a priori knowledge of the original spectrum \\(X(f)\\), it is not possible to confirm whether the shift was due to multiplication by \\(e^{2\\pi i f_0 t}\\) or if the original signal itself had a different form. Other factors or transformations could potentially yield a similar shifted spectrum.
